intro: Phyllanthus vulcani, commonly known as the volcanic phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the volcanic regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its volcanic habitat. Its unique morphology includes a short stem with dense foliage, which helps it conserve water in arid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its specialized adaptations and potential ecological significance in its native ecosystem.
